definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: The people jumped up and cried.
The woman was startled to see a stranger.
sentences.chinese: 那位产妇发现是位陌生人，惊跳起来。

sentences.english: The sudden noise in the bushes startled her horse.
sentences.chinese: 灌木丛中突然发出的怪声使她的马惊跳起来。

sentences.english: Suddenly he started up from the chair .
sentences.chinese: 突然间他从椅子上惊跳起来。

sentences.english: My friends are leaping whenever their cell phones ring.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友们一听到自己的手机铃响就会惊跳起来。

sentences.english: The noise of the gun made him jump.
The lad started, as if (he was) awakened from some dream.
sentences.chinese: 那小伙惊跳了起来，仿佛从梦中惊醒过来。

sentences.english: I start up and stretch my hands to touch you.
sentences.chinese: 我惊跳起来，伸手去触摸你。

sentences.english: The prisoner gave a start when he heard the sentence.
sentences.chinese: 那犯人听到判决时惊跳起来。

sentences.english: He started up from his seat.
My heart was jumping with fear .

sentences.chinese: 那条消息使我惊跳起来。

definition: see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
with a rolling or twisting movement/in a single movement/in one breath
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
(of the heart) palpitating with fear/palpitation (Chinese medicine)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
to be off in another world/to suffer a lapse in concentration
